I was particularly drawn to tales that resonate with the unique Nigerian or African experience, such as:  
- “Ganger,” a novelette depicting an AI-run super-city that shelters millions of environmental refugees at the expense of free will and individualism.  
- “Nigerian Dreams,” a poignant narrative capturing the enduring aspiration of Nigerians to leave their homeland in search of better opportunities.
conclusion: While *Convergence Problems* offers a refreshing Nigerian perspective in speculative fiction and includes some standout stories, it falls short of being a cohesive and emotionally impactful collection.
